snippet: Retailers enjoyed an average 2.7 percent increase in same-store sales, but analysts were looking ahead to November’s results to assess Hurricane Sandy’s impact.
abstract: Results tallied from 18 national retailers tracked by Thomson Reuters show shoppers continued to spend steadily at retailers in October, from discounters to high end stores, suggesting consumer confidence heading into the holiday season; retailers enjoyed average increase of 2.7 percent in same-store sales; results largely excluded effects of Hurricane Sandy.
lead_paragraph: Retailers enjoyed an average 2.7 percent increase in same-store sales, but analysts were looking ahead to November’s results to assess Hurricane Sandy’s impact.

headline.seo: An October Lift for Retailers, but Storm’s Effects Will Come Next Month
headline.main: Month of Gains for Stores, Before a Storm’s Toll
headline.print_headline: Month of Gains for Stores, Before a Storm’s Toll
